Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: OtisMed and its CEO Charlie Chi pleaded guilty in federal court in Newark, New Jersey. OtisMed pleaded guilty before U.S. District Judge Claire C. Cecchi to an information charging it with distributing, with the intent to defraud and mislead, adulterated medical devices into interstate commerce in violation of the Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. Judge Cecchi fined OtisMed $34.4 million and ordered $5.16 million in criminal forfeiture. In a separate civil settlement, OtisMed agreed to pay $40 million plus interest to resolve its civil liability.
Agency: Food and Drug Administration referral to the Justice Department

Description: Kalamazoo, Mich.-based Stryker Corporation and its former outpatient therapy division, Physiotherapy Associates Inc., agreed to pay the United States $16.6 million to settle allegations that Physiotherapy submitted false claims to Medicare and other federal health care programs.

Wright was offered a deferred prosecution agreement to resolve charges that it violated the federal anti-kickback statute by entering into consulting agreements with certain orthopaedic surgeons which were designed and implemented, in part, to induce the surgeons to use, and cause the purchase of, Wright's hip and knee reconstruction and replacement products. The company also agreed to pay $7.9 million to resolve related civil False Claims Act allegations.

Secondary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: OtisMed agreed to pay $376,700 to settle multistate litigation alleging that it distributed, with the intent to defraud and mislead, adulterated medical devices into interstate commerce and thus caused false claims to be submitted to state Medicaid programs. This was part of a larger $79 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-otismed-corp

Primary Offense: off-label or unapproved promotion of medical products
Description: Stryker Biotech agreed to pay $1.35 million in settlement of allegations it marketed orthopedic products for uses that were not approved by the U.S. Food & Drug Administration.

Primary Offense: off-label or unapproved promotion of medical products
Description: alleged involvement in an unlawful scheme to promote bone growth products
failure to pay out-of-state business registration fee

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation

Info Source: FEDERAL GOVERNMENT RECOVERS $345,000 IN ORTHOPEDIC SURGICAL PRODUCTS KICKBACK SCHEME, US Fed News, May 25, 2006 (via Nexis).

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: Wright Medical Group agreed to pay $240 million to settle multi-district litigation alleging defects in its metal-on-metal hip implants: https://www.lawyersandsettlements.com/legal-news/wright-profemur-total-hip-z-system-implants-alleging/Wright-defective-hip-implant-mdl-settlement-21836.html
Private Litigation Case Title: In Re: Wright Medical Technology, Inc., Conserve Hip Implant Products Liability Litigation

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: Stryker announced that it had recorded a charge to earnings of $1.425 billion to cover the costs of settling multi-district litigation concerning allegedly defective metal hip replacement parts: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/310764/000031076414000194/syk110314exhibit991.htm
Private Litigation Case Title: In re: Stryker Rejuvenate and ABG II Hip Implant Products Liability Litigation
